generif.text: Galectin-1 possesses a cell growth-inhibitory site which is not part of the beta-galactoside binding site: a surface loop, comprising amino acid residues 25-30 and joining two internal beta-strands, forms part of the growth-inhibitory site.

name: galectin 1

reactome.name: Regulation of Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF) transport and uptake by Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding Proteins (IGFBPs)

summary: The galectins are a family of beta-galactoside-binding proteins implicated in modulating cell-cell and cell-matrix interactions. This gene product may act as an autocrine negative growth factor that regulates cell proliferation. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
